segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 6
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 6

segments.pli: 4. devatāvagga
segments.en: 4. Deities

segments.pli: 39. Nidānasutta
segments.en: 39. Sources

segments.pli: “Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Katamāni tīṇi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Lobho nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya, doso nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya, moho nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: Greed, hate, and delusion are sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, lobhā alobho samudeti;
segments.en: Greed doesn’t give rise to contentment.

segments.pli: atha kho, bhikkhave, lobhā lobhova samudeti.
segments.en: Rather, greed just gives rise to greed.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, dosā adoso samudeti;
segments.en: Hate doesn’t give rise to love.

segments.pli: atha kho, bhikkhave, dosā dosova samudeti.
segments.en: Rather, hate just gives rise to hate.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, mohā amoho samudeti;
segments.en: Delusion doesn’t give rise to understanding.

segments.pli: atha kho, bhikkhave, mohā mohova samudeti.
segments.en: Rather, delusion just gives rise to delusion.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, lobhajena kammena dosajena kammena mohajena kammena devā paññāyanti, manussā paññāyanti, yā vā panaññāpi kāci sugatiyo.
segments.en: It’s not because of deeds born of greed, hate, and delusion that gods, humans, or those in any other good places are found.

segments.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, lobhajena kammena dosajena kammena mohajena kammena nirayo paññāyati tiracchānayoni paññāyati pettivisayo paññāyati, yā vā panaññāpi kāci duggatiyo.
segments.en: Rather, it’s because of deeds born of greed, hate, and delusion that hell, the animal realm, the ghost realm, or any other bad places are found.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Katamāni tīṇi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Alobho nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya, adoso nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya, amoho nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: Contentment, love, and understanding are sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, alobhā lobho samudeti;
segments.en: Contentment doesn’t give rise to greed.

segments.pli: atha kho, bhikkhave, alobhā alobhova samudeti.
segments.en: Rather, contentment just gives rise to contentment.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, adosā doso samudeti;
segments.en: Love doesn’t give rise to hate.

segments.pli: atha kho, bhikkhave, adosā adosova samudeti.
segments.en: Rather, love just gives rise to love.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, amohā moho samudeti;
segments.en: Understanding doesn’t give rise to delusion.

segments.pli: atha kho, bhikkhave, amohā amohova samudeti.
segments.en: Rather, understanding just gives rise to understanding.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, alobhajena kammena adosajena kammena amohajena kammena nirayo paññāyati tiracchānayoni paññāyati pettivisayo paññāyati, yā vā panaññāpi kāci duggatiyo.
segments.en: It’s not because of deeds born of contentment, love, and understanding that hell, the animal realm, the ghost realm, or any other bad places are found.

segments.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, alobhajena kammena adosajena kammena amohajena kammena devā paññāyanti, manussā paññāyanti, yā vā panaññāpi kāci sugatiyo.
segments.en: Rather, it’s because of deeds born of contentment, love, and understanding that gods, humans, or those in any other good places are found.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāyā”ti.
segments.en: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.
